definition[0]: to contain many things of the same kind
example[1]: His essay was full of mistakes.
example[2]: The music papers were full of gossip about the band.
example[3]: Life’s full of surprises, isn’t it?
definition[1]: to feel, express, or show a lot of a particular emotion or quality
example[4]: Lucy was a happy child, always full of life.
example[5]: He was full of praise for the work of the unit.
definition[2]: to talk or think a lot about a particular thing
example[6]: She was full of plans for the wedding.
